body.name: Kenneth Cole REACTION Men's Perfect Fit Adjustable Belt – Track Lock and Compression Buckle Styles
features: Fabric type 52% Polyurethane, 24% Polyester, 24% Bonded Leather

PERFECT FIT: This KCR men's belt is engineered for comfort. It adjusts every 1/4 inch for a total custom fit. Get only the best with this track lock system to obtain the most comfortable fit with each wear.

KCR STYLE: Kenneth Cole compression belt is the perfect add to your current belt selection. With no holes and a simple, sleek design, this belt can tie together any look and instantly elevate your outfit.
FEATURES: Belt strap width measures 1.4 inches to seamlessly slide in your belt loops. For best care, spot clean only.

SIZING: For best fit, order a size 2 inches larger than your waist size. If your waist size is 36", order belt size Large (38-40). Available in sizes Small (30-32), Medium (34-36), Large (38-40) and X-Large (42-44).
body.description: An essential accessory in every men's wardrobe, this Kenneth Cole Reaction men's belt will feel secure and comfortable for all-day wear. The belt features a track lock that allows you to adjust every 1/4-inch for a total custom fit. Respectable refinement at its best, this belt from Kenneth Cole Reaction is the perfect addition to your collection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally a belt that can get just the right fit to feel comfortable!
reviews.reviewText: As someone who has struggled to find comfortable and long-lasting belts in the past, the Kenneth Cole compression belt has been a game-changer for me. I love how this belt clicks into place at more frequent intervals, ensuring a perfect fit every time. The small notches on the back of the belt provide just the right amount of support, even after two years of use. Although the belt buckle has some wear and tear from regular use, it still looks great and continues to hold up nicely. If you're looking for a stylish and reliable belt that will last, the Kenneth Cole compression belt is definitely worth checking out.Summary: Nice looking. Easy to use. Good Quality product

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Holds tight, easy to remove
reviews.reviewText: My previous adjustable belt didn’t have a track. Instead, a roller got a good grip on the belt to hold it in place. Unfortunately the belt material was thin and eventually tore. With this new track system the buckle hangs on with a spring loaded clip on the bottom. There’s a small latch on the buckle to lift the clip and remove the belt. My gf hasn’t yet figured out how to operate it. She can’t rip off my pants when she’s feeling randy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great looking, good fit, hard release button
reviews.reviewText: This isn't my first Kenneth Cole ratcheting belt. I bought the Classic Brown option from this series as well.The Classic Brown one is 5-star. I love it. I wear it everyday for the last year or so when I wear my brown work Khakis.So, the quality is there. This black belt is very stylish, durable, and comfortable for a 34 inch waist on the Large size.I bought 2 of these. One for me and one for a Christmas gift. So, I was able to test 2 of them at the same time.The only issue I found was actually kind of terrifying at first. I ratcheted the belt to a snug fit and felt good. Then I tried to undo the "release" lever on the side of the buckle. This is a common design for the Kenneth Cole Perfect Fit belts. Well, it didn't "click" off and release pressure. I kept trying. I felt like I had to be doing something wrong or going the wrong direction. Pretty soon, I felt like a cat stuck in a bag handle. I was bouncing around, panicked it wouldn't release. I had to disrobe with the belt tight, which was painfully difficult. After the pressure of my waist was gone, holding my pants and belt in front me the lever popped easily to release pressure.I practiced several times to get used to the "direction" I had to go. It was the same as the other belt I own. I put the pants on again, and tightened the belt. Same problem, I was fiddling with the lever a lot and it wouldn't give. However, this time I knew how it worked. I gave it an extra effort beyond what I think is reasonable for this release and it popped. Definitely hurt the fingers a little bit. I checked the 2nd belt, and it was the exact same feel on the release.The 1st belt had some stretch to it and I concerned I broke it or loosed the buckled end. I actually took it a part and this is strong metal with a clamp system for the end of the belt to the leather. What I learned here is this product is a high quality belt that doesn't rely on some dinky set screws into leather to hold it together. Major plus here for long term durability, and trimming and fixing later.My advice when you get the belt, practice with the release before you put it on. Remember, it will take some doing to get the lever to pop and release the ratchet pressure. The quality, strength, and style greatly out weigh its one flaw. Plus, over time, it might release easier as it wears in.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don’t buy-Hard to take off if not done exactly right
reviews.reviewText: Update 1-15-24: After having this belt for a few months I have almost cut it off multiple times. If the belt is tightened “too far” it won’t unlatch & I have had to do everything but cut it to get it off.Tough to unlatch and take off. To take off this belt, you need to pull on the belt as if you are going to tighten it & then unlatch the belt. I had to read other reviews before figuring this out and was about to cut the belt off and send it back. This is a nice quality belt however it is very tough to take off if not done exactly correct.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Runs small - sizing chart is wrong
reviews.reviewText: The sizing chart shows pants waist size + 2" to get belt size. That's not correct. The "track" part is almost 4" from the end of the belt, so add 4" instead of 2". I had to return the first one ordered for next larger size. Nice belt and now it's a perfect fit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Ok, but just
reviews.reviewText: The belt looks great but the leather could have been better. I can easily see it starting to peal In a few months

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This belt looks great with semi formal clothes and even pretty good with more casual outfits (jeans with a polo shirt, etc) Easy to size, easy to assemble. Had been very durable so far. It’s also great to have a near-infinite amount of sizes to choose from because I bought this for a cruise, and god knows adjusting your belt size is necessary on a cruise. Totally recommend
I received the belt on time and my husband was very happy with the belt. Good quality

Elegante y sencilloLa forma de abrochar el cinturón es muy práctica y no lastima el cinturon, por lo que no se hace ninguna marca de doblado como con un cinturón regularPara desabrocharlo si batalle un poco en acostumbrarme al mecanismo, pero ya una vez que le agarras la onda si es muy fácil
It came big so that we can customize the size. Was easy to do. Looks great

Excelente calidad de los materiales y funcionamiento. La calidad del cuero es muy buena se nota mucho la diferencia contra otros. Un detalles que mejoraron respecto a otros modelos es el mecanismo de fijación de la hebilla hacia el cuero, anteriormente ese era su punto débil pero aun así tenían un durabilidad por arriba de muchos otros.
